clinical_study.brief_title: PREDICtors for Quality of Life After Sigmoidectomy for DIVerticular Disease
clinical_study.official_title: PREDICtors for Health Related Quality of Life After Elective Sigmoidectomy for DIVerticular Disease: The PREDIC-DIV Study

brief_summary.textblock: To identify predictors for postoperative health related quality of life after elective sigmoidectomy for diverticular disease.

detailed_description.textblock: According to current international guidelines, indications for surgical treatment of diverticular disease are inhomogeneous. To date, the measurement of pre- and postoperative quality of life (QoL) is underrepresented. To ensure an individually tailored therapeutical approach, and to avoid unnecessary surgery as well as the risk of a hazardous chronification of the disease, QoL importantly needs to be focused within the decisional process for the best treatment option. The aim of the PREDIC DIV-Study is, to identify predictors for a better postoperative quality of life in patients who undergo elective sigmoidectomy for diverticular disease. PREDIC DIV is a prospective observational study.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative quality of life (QoL) after a follow up of six month: SF-36
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be assessed by use of the SF36- questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative quality of life (QoL) after a follow up of six month: GI-Quality of Life Index
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be assessed by use of GI-Quality of Life Index-questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative quality of life (QoL) after a follow up of six month: Visual analogue scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be assessed by use of a visual analogue scale (VAS). The scale ranges from 0 to 100 mm. 0 is the least desirable condition. 100 is the most desirable condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life after a follow up of 24 month: SF-36
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be assessed by use of SF36-questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life after a follow up of 24 month: GI-Quality of Life Index
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be assessed by use GI-Quality of Life index-questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life after a follow up of 24 month: Visual analogue scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be assessed by use of a visual analogue scale (VAS). The scale ranges from 0 to 100 mm. 0 is the least desirable condition. 100 is the most desirable condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Peri- und postoperative morbidity
secondary_outcome.description: Assessement by use of Clavien-Dindo-Classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality is defined as 30-days postoperative mortality and mortality in association to diverticulitis recurrency

secondary_outcome.measure: Coexisting characteristics of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
secondary_outcome.description: IBS-scoring will be performed pre- and postoperatively by use of ROME IV criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective assessment of Diverticulitis severity
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the patients subjective estimate on disease severity by use of a visual analogue scale (VAS). The scale ranges from 0 to 100 mm. 0 is the least desirable condition (=most severe imaginable diverticulitis). 100 is the most desirable condition (=no diverticulitis).

secondary_outcome.description: CT-scan based grading of diverticulitis in uncomplicated or complicated disease according to Classification of Diverticular Disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Diverticulitis severity: Ambrossetti Classification
secondary_outcome.description: CT-scan based grading of diverticulitis in uncomplicated or complicated disease according to Ambrossetti Classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Diverticulitis severity: Modified Hinchey Classification
secondary_outcome.description: CT-scan based grading of diverticulitis in uncomplicated or complicated disease according to Modified Hinchey Classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Diverticulitis severity according to preoperative CT-scan
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation for evidence of pericolic gas

secondary_outcome.measure: Diverticulitis severity according to preoperative CT-scan
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation for evidence of pericolic or pelvic abscess

secondary_outcome.measure: Diverticulitis severity
secondary_outcome.description: histological grading of inflammation in the resected bowel (Grade 1-4)

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of guideline specific treatment on postoperative quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative comparison of indication for surgery with given indications in relevant international Guidelines (German, US, Danish, GB, Italian, Dutch). Review of the association between a guideline-matching treatment and postoperative quality of life. Identification of the guideline, which potentially leads to the best achieved quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative changes in fecal continence

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative changes in urinary continence

biospec_descr.textblock: The resected part of the bowel is histopathologically examinated and stored routinely for all patients (participants of the study as well as not participating patients)

study_pop.textblock: All patients > 18 years, matching to inclusion and exclusion criteria, who are scheduled for elective sigmoidectomy for diverticular disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients, scheduled for elective sigmoidectomy for diverticular disease (Indication: foregoing acute diverticulitis with pericolic or pelvic abscess >1cm, ongoing complaints after acute uncomplicated diverticulitis, recurrent uncomplicated disease (three or more diverticulitis episodes in combination with the patients wish for surgery), recurrent complicated disease (three or more diverticulitis episodes+complications: stenosis, fistula, chronic pain), urgent wish of patients for surgery after uncomplicated disease.
- Age >18 years
- ASA 1-3
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- ASA 4
- acute diverticulitis with free perforation
- acute or forgoing diverticular bleeding
- colorectal malignancies (current or foregoing)
- immunosuppression (corticoids > 20 mg prednisolon/d, status post transplant)
- advanced malignancy with systemic metastases
